descript.abstract: This database contains 4,881 marine mammal and turtle sightings from aerial surveys conducted by Cascadia Research on 189 days between 1 July 1995 and 5 October 1998 off central California. Surveys were conducted throughout the year as a part of an assessment of the impact of the ATOC sound source on the distribution of marine mammals. The study site was centered around the Acoustic Thermometry of Ocean Climate’s (ATOC) sound source located on the west side of Pioneer Seamount off central California. These surveys were timed to occur before, during, and after sound transmissions from the ATOC sound source (during the experimental period the sound source was transmitting 25 minutes every 4 hours). Aerial surveys were conducted by three observers from a high-wing Partenavia P-68 twin-engine aircraft equipped with side bubble windows and a belly window. Surveys were designed to repeatedly cover a systematic transect grid centered over the sound source. Survey effort was stratified into an inner box, 40 x 40 km (1,600 sq km), and outer box, 80 x 80 km (4,800 sq km when the inner box is subtracted). A minimum of 19 species of marine mammals were identified including five species of mysticete whale, ten species of odontocetes, and four species of pinnipeds. There were clear seasonal patterns in the relative occurrence of many migratory species such as baleen whales. There were some subtle but significant displacement of humpback and sperm whales around the sound source during transmissions.
descript.purpose: Surveys were conducted throughout the year as a part of an assessment of the impact of the ATOC sound source on the distribution of marine mammals.
descript.supplinf: The surveys covered were concentrated in and around the 80 km by 80 km study area around Pioneer Seamount. Primary utility of the data is to examine habitat and seasonal differences in occurrence of different species. Subtle changes in distribution of sightings of some species were detected near the sound source in response to sound transmissions, so occurrence of some species might reflect a slight alteration from normal. Dataset is provided for use on the OBIS-SEAMAP website only under the Terms of Use stated on the website. Ownership of this dataset remains with Cascadia Research and is not to be used for other purposes without written permission of Cascadia Research.

idinfo.accconst: Open public unless otherwise noted. See Use Constraints for details.
idinfo.useconst:
1. Not to use data obtained from OBIS-SEAMAP in any publication, product, or commercial application without proper attribution to the original data provider(s) and OBIS-SEAMAP unless the datasets are explicitly shown under the CC0 policy. Citations or credits are suggested as attribution. If the data you downloaded come from multiple datasets, a citation or credit to each of the datasets is required.
Suggested citation for this dataset:
Calambokidis, J. 2012. Cascadia Research ATOC Aerial Surveys. Data downloaded from OBIS-SEAMAP (http://seamap.env.duke.edu/dataset/362) on yyyy-mm-dd.
Suggested citation for OBIS-SEAMAP:
Halpin, P.N., A.J. Read, E. Fujioka, B.D. Best, B. Donnelly, L.J. Hazen, C. Kot, K. Urian, E. LaBrecque, A. Dimatteo, J. Cleary, C. Good, L.B. Crowder, and K.D. Hyrenbach. 2009. OBIS-SEAMAP: The world data center for marine mammal, sea bird, and sea turtle distributions. Oceanography 22(2):104-115
2. To forward the citation of any publication / report that made use of the data / tools provided by OBIS-SEAMAP for inclusion in our list of references.
3. Not to hold OBIS-SEAMAP or the original data providers liable for errors in the data. While we have made every effort to ensure the quality of the database, we cannot guarantee the accuracy of these datasets.
4. The burden for determining fitness for use of the downloaded data for any analyses lies entirely with the user. OBIS-SEAMAP or the original data providers do not support outcomes of your analyses that used the data you downloaded from OBIS-SEAMAP.
5. To consider inclusion of the accompanying transect (effort) dataset if available into the methodology of your analyses.
6. Not to redistribute the data you downloaded from OBIS-SEAMAP through any media without contect from OBIS-SEAMAP and the original data providers unless the datasets are explicitly shown under the CC0 policy.

dataqual.logic: Permissible values for date and time and coordinates were validated by the data provider and the OBIS-SEAMAP data manager. Species identification by the data provider was matched with Integrated Taxonomic Information System.

procstep.procdesc: Data were put through the OBIS-SEAMAP data registration steps.

cntorgp.cntorg: Nicholas School of Environment, Duke Univ.

distinfo.distliab: Not to hold OBIS-SEAMAP liable for errors in the data. While we have made every effort to ensure the quality of the database, we cannot guarantee the accuracy of these datasets. Also please refer to Use Constraints.
